revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian |name=Kyle Kinane |image=Kyle Kinane.jpg |caption=Kyle Kinane in 2013 |birth_name=Kyle Christian Kinane |birth_date={{Birth date and age|1976|12|23}} |birth_place= |active= }} '''Kyle Christian Kinane''' (born December 23, 1976) is an [[United States|American]] stand-up comedian, actor and voice actor from [[Addison, Illinois]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Collins|first=Sarah|date=February 25, 2011|title=Kyle Kinane: The Chicago ex-pat comedian on his stint in a punk band, not being a misanthrope, and growing up in Addison|url=http://www.avclub.com/article/kyle-kinane-51805|newspaper=[[The A.V. Club]]|location=[[Chicago, Illinois]]|access-date=March 11, 2017}}</ref>
==Career== Kinane's first television appearance was on ''[[The Nanny]]'' playing "Young [[Roger Clinton, Jr.|Roger Clinton]]".{{Citation needed|date=March 2015}}
His debut album ''Death of the Party'', recorded at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] in Los Angeles and released in 2010 on [[AST Records]], was met with critical acclaim.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://comedians.about.com/b/2010/02/05/kyle-kinane-death-of-the-party-album-review.htm |title=Kyle Kinane: Death of the Party - Album Review |publisher=Comedians.about.com |date=2011-05-11 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> Kinane was named in ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]''{{'}}s "Ten Comics to Watch in 2010".<ref>{{cite web|last=Heisler |first=Steve |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118021687.html?categoryid=15&cs=1&ref=vertlegit |title=10 Comics to Watch: Kyle Kinane - Entertainment News, Legit News, Media |publisher=Variety |date=2010-07-13 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref>
Kinane has had a longstanding relationship with the cable channel [[Comedy Central]], including serving as the voice for their on-air announcements since 2011.<ref name="Comedy Central Insider">{{cite web|last=Gonzalo|first=Cordova|title=Comedy Central Insider - Kyle Kinane Is the New Voice of Comedy Central|url=http://ccinsider.comedycentral.com/2011/11/14/kyle-kinane-is-the-new-voice-of-comedy-central|work=Comedy Central Insider|publisher=Comedy Central Insider|accessdate=November 15, 2012}}</ref> His first ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' half-hour special was on February 25, 2011. Other Comedy Central programs on which he has appeared include ''[[Drunk History]]'' (on which he retold the story of the [[Haymarket affair]] while drunk), the game show ''[[@midnight]]'', which he has won seven times,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cc.com/shows/-midnight/guests |title=At Midnight | Guest Interviews & Bios | Comedy Central |website=Cc.com |date=2016-09-30 |accessdate=2017-01-20}}</ref> and the 2014 animated series ''[[TripTank]]''.<ref name="Multichannel News">{{cite web|last=Rubino|first=Lindsay|title=Multichannel News - Comedy Central Greenlights Series on Animated Shorts|url=http://www.multichannel.com/content/comedy-central-greenlights-series-animated-shorts/139885|work=Multichannel News|publisher=Multichannel News|accessdate=October 31, 2012}}</ref>
Kinane's first stand-up comedy DVD special, ''Whiskey Icarus'', was released in 2012. His second stand-up DVD special, ''"I Liked His Old Stuff Better,"'' was released in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kylekinane.comedydirect.com/ |title=Kyle Kinane |website=Kylekinane.comedydirect.com |date= |accessdate=2017-01-20}}</ref>
Kinane has performed his stand-up on television programs ''[[Last Call with Carson Daly]]'', ''[[Live at Gotham]]'', ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' and ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]''. He has opened for comedians [[Patton Oswalt]] and [[Daniel Tosh]] on tour.
He has appeared on many audio and video [[podcast]]s, including ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'', ''[[Doug Loves Movies]]'', ''[[Getting Doug with High]]'', ''The Grandma's Virginity Podcast'', ''[[The Nerdist Podcast]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nerdist.com/2010/12/nerdist-podcast-51-comedians-you-should-know/ |title=Nerdist Podcast #51: "The Art of Wrestling" with Colt Cabana, Comedians You Should Know! |publisher=Nerdist.com |date= |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> ''[[Comedy Film Nerds]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dailysplice.com/directory/Comedy-Film-Nerds-podcast/episode-789707 |title=Ep 58 with Kyle Kinane on Comedy Film Nerds |publisher=DailySplice |date=2011-05-16 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> ''[[Stop Podcasting Yourself]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maximumfun.org/stop-podcasting-yourself/stop-podcasting-yourself-133-kyle-kinane |title=Stop Podcasting Yourself 133 - Kyle Kinane |publisher=Maximum Fun |date=2010-09-27 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> ''[[The Adam Carolla Show (podcast)|The Adam Carolla Show]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.adamcarolla.com/ACPBlog/2011/06/06/kyle-kinane/ |title=The Adam Carolla Show - Kyle Kinane | The Adam Carolla Show |publisher=Adamcarolla.com |date=2011-06-06 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> ''[[You Made It Weird with Pete Holmes]]'',<ref>{{cite web|title=You Made it Weird #30: Kyle Kinane|url=http://www.nerdist.com/pepisode/you-made-it-weird-30-kyle-kinane/|website=Nerdist|accessdate=6 July 2014}}</ref> ''[[All Growz Up with Melinda Hill]]''<ref>{{cite web |last=Carrie |first=Stephanie |title=Steph's LA Weekly Feature Series â€“ Melinda Hill's Romantic Encounters |url=http://tangledwebwewatch.com/2013/07/17/stephs-la-weekly-feature-series-melinda-hills-romantic-encounters/ |accessdate=15 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019203316/http://tangledwebwewatch.com/2013/07/17/stephs-la-weekly-feature-series-melinda-hills-romantic-encounters/ |archivedate=19 October 2013 |df= }}</ref> ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]], and [[Colt Cabana|The Art of Wrestling with Colt Cabana]]''<ref>{{cite web|title = AOW 265 Edinburgh LIVE Part 3: Drew Galloway, Kyle Kinane, Graham Clark, Max Olesker|url = https://m.soundcloud.com/coltcabana/aow-265-edinburgh-live-part-3-drew-galloway-kyle-kinane-graham-clark-max-olesker|website = SoundCloud|accessdate = 2015-08-28}}</ref>
Kinane also runs his own Podcast along with fellow comedian and outdoor cat, Dave Stone, entitled "The Boogie Monster"
Kinane plays the coke-head ex-boyfriend of [[Gillian Jacobs]] in [[Judd Apatow]]'s [[Netflix]] series ''[[Love (TV series)|Love]]''.
He is the voice of Ice Cream in the short-lived [[Disney XD]] series ''[[Right Now Kapow]]''.
He plays Rod on the [[TruTV]] series, ''[[Those Who Can't]]''.
Kinane is an avid needle pointer and crotchet knitter. As a teenager, he was active in 4H and would often enter his creations in county fairs as mentioned in Boogie Monster episode "Dogs & Cats" 2/27/2018.<ref>http://boogiemonster.libsyn.com/</ref>
==Discography==
{| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Album |- | 2010 | ''Death of the Party'' |- | 2012 | ''Whiskey Icarus'' |- | 2015 | ''I Liked His Old Stuff Better'' |- | 2016 | ''Loose in Chicago'' |}
==Filmography==
===Film=== *2009, Paparazzi at Medical Center in ''[[Funny People]]'' *2013, Biker Dude (voice) in ''[[Epic (2013 film)|Epic]]'' *2015, Kyle the Demon (voice) in ''[[Hell and Back (film)|Hell and Back]]'' *2017, Kenny Crandall in ''Random Tropical Paradise'' *2017, Rabbit in ''[[Izzy Gets the F*ck Across Town]]'' *2017, Kevin Garvey in ''[[The House (2017 film)|The House]]''
===Television=== *2012, Rat Daddy on "[[Bob's Burgers]]" episode Ear-sy Rider. *2015, ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' season 2, episode 16. *2015, Cloud Dance on ''[[Adventure Time]]'' *2016, Eric on ''[[Love (TV series)|Love]]'' on [[Netflix]]. *2016, Ice Cream, on ''[[Right Now Kapow]]'' on [[Disney XD]]. *2016, Rod Knorr on "[[Those Who Can't]]" on [[TruTV]]. *2018, Bullet (voice) on ''[[Paradise PD]]'' on [[Netflix]]
